page.title: 01Chailey
page.content: Chailey is a village in three parts, North, South and the old village between these two. There are two churches, three pubs, a primary school, a comprehensive school and a garage. Many clubs and societies thrive in the village. There is the Chailey commons Society, the Horticultural Society and the Bonfire Society. The biggest village occasion is the annual Beating of the Bounds race organised by the Parochial Church Council. The Busy A272 road bisects North Chailey and the A272 passes thorough the south, the houses are mainly spread alongside these roads. Chailey is most well known because of the Chailey Heritage School in the north which teaches physically handicapped chidren. Visitors come from all over the world to visit
